issue.title: Conversion specification problem in chrono::duration constructor

discussion.p: The converting constructor in std::chrono::duration is current specified as ( p1):

blockquote.pre: template<class Rep2> constexpr explicit duration(const Rep2& r);

blockquote.p: Remarks: This constructor shall not participate in overload resolution unless Rep2 is implicitly convertible to rep and […]

discussion.p: But the parameter is of type Rep2 const, so we should check that Rep2 const is implicitly convertible to rep, not just Rep2. This means that for a type like:

blockquote.pre: struct X { operator int64_t() /* not const */; };

discussion.p: std::is_constructible_v<std::chrono::seconds, X> is true, but actual construction will fail to compile.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4713.

blockquote.pre: template<class Rep2> constexpr explicit duration(const Rep2& r);

blockquote.p:
-1- Remarks: This constructor shall not participate in overload resolution unless const Rep2 is implicitly convertible to rep and
(1.1) — treat_as_floating_point_v<rep> is true or
(1.2) — treat_as_floating_point_v<Rep2> is false.
[…]
-2- Effects: Constructs an object of type duration.
-3- Postconditions: count() == static_cast<rep>(r).
